messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish/french
messages.msgSnippet: And may I ask, where would I get this information from? I ve only been unschooling 9 weeks since I took my daughter out of ps. She is still de-schooling to be
messages.messageBody:
And may I ask, where would I get this information from? I've only been unschooling 9 weeks since I took my daughter out of ps.
She is still de-schooling to be sure but we both together are exploring different areas of language. She is already bi-lingual with sign language and shouldn't have any problems picking up french or spanish or any other language.
I know a little...more the spelling than anything else...monsier, mademoisille, madame, au revior and thats it I think. LOL
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana
http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com
-----Original Message-----
From: Lynda <lurine@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Wednesday, April 18, 2001 12:11 AM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish/french

The kidlets like Standard Diviants.  They are videos, tapes and books.
 
Lynda
----- Original Message -----
From: Vaughnde Edwards
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 3:17 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish/french

Thanks guys for typing out how to pronounce these. I am deaf so this goes a long way in being a big help! My daughter is always correcting my speech <G>. Hamburger I will never ever get right no matter how hard I try!
 
Btw, Anyone got some ideas for easy french books with audio tapes?? Cheap too please!
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana
http://www.stampinbookworm.eboard.com
-----Original Message-----
From: Johanna <saninocencio1@...>
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Date: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 3:23 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish

one - uno/una (oo-noh/oo-nah)
two - dos (dose)
three - tres (trehs)
four - cuatro(kwah-tro)
five - cinco (theen-co)
six - seis (seh-eese)
seven - siete (syeh-teh)
eight - ocho (oh-cho)
nine - nueve (nweh-beh)
ten - diez (dee-yeth)
 
 
Johanna
Life is the ultimate learning experience!
----- Original Message -----
From: staclarspr@...
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, April 17, 2001 10:41 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish

teaching the spainsh numbers
can't find a complete list of one thru 10.
anyone out there have one?

Linda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish/french
messages.msgSnippet: http://www.parlo.com  They will send out lessons in your email and its free! I have one doing spanish, one french and one japanese :) As you can imagine its
messages.messageBody:
http://www.parlo.com They will send out lessons in your email and its free!
I have one doing spanish, one french and one japanese :) As you can imagine
its can get really crazy at dinner :)
Tami

messages.subject: RE: [Unschooling-dotcom] tch/spanish/french
messages.msgSnippet: Btw, Anyone got some ideas for easy french books with audio tapes?? Cheap too please! Vaughnde Lee Missoula, Montana ***Try Dover books. Their latest catalog
messages.messageBody:
Btw, Anyone got some ideas for easy french books with audio tapes?? Cheap too please!
 
Vaughnde Lee
Missoula, Montana 
 
***Try Dover books. Their latest catalog had several dual-language books, including "Listen and Enjoy French Poetry"
 
http://www.doverpublications.com
 
V alerie in tacoma
